===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
Uncertain. For dictionary purposes the bottom element is analyzed as {{zh-l|*凵|container}}. The top element resembles {{zh-l|*屮|sprout}}, thus analysed by many as "sprout emerging". Oracle bones character may represent a "foot coming out of an enclosure".

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|で}}
The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|出る|tr=deru||to come out}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|で|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|で}}

# the process of something coming [[out]]
# something that [[come]]s out

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|しゅつ}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しゅつ}} {{m|zh|出|tr=tsyhwit||to go or come out}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|しゅつ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しゅつ}}

# being from a certain place
# coming out

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ず}}
Contraction of verb {{m|ja|出ず|tr=izu||to go or come out|pos=obsolete}}

====Verb====
{{ja-verb|type=ni|ず|hhira=づ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=す'|obsolete}} to go or come out

====Usage notes====
The {{m|ja|出る|tr=deru}} form is now the standard term for this in modern Japanese.
